website_summaries.verdict: A powerful and versatile dive light that has multiple settings and is rated for a depth of up to 90 m.
pros: Light and Motion's SOLA 1200 Dive Light features a flood and a spot mode
Each mode has three power settings, offering you a wide selection of lighting options
At the lowest setting, this dive light will last approximately 270 min
cons: It's very expensive, but many believe the cost is acceptable for what the light offers

customer_reviews.title: Great dive light for night or day.  Our light was getting low after 30 minutes of a night dive at full power.
customer_reviews.text: A little expensive but a great light. Bought this for my wife and I could really see the difference between that and my Gobe. This sola 1200 really lights up a night dive and the strap is great. The battery life seemed get into the yellow or low juice mode only after 30 minutes of diving at 45 feet in 78 degree water and that was on full charge but using the highest lighting setting. Great product. It really put everyone else lights to shame.
customer_reviews.author: patrick harris

customer_reviews.title: Great Light! Well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: This light is so versatile. I could tone it down and be less obtrusive with a low narrow beam setting or I could light up a very large area and see what was around to go check out when using the broad beam high setting. It was far and away the best light on our dive boat
customer_reviews.author: D. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great light
customer_reviews.text: I only have use this for one night drive so far but it definitely delivered. I did an awesome job lighting up a nice area that I was looking at and it was definitely the most powerful light on the boat. I have to say I also really loved the handgrip thing with this light. It made such a huge difference underwater to not have to be holding a flashlight. If you got the money and you like night dives I suggest you consider this light. The optional controls on this light are a little bit hard to figure out for me and I really wasn’t able to do more than turn it on and turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Beats every light my friends have
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light. I got it for a trip to Bali where I was going to do a lot of underwater photography and night dives. This light outperformed every other light the group used for the night dives. The wide angle is great and very bright. It is also nice to be able to switch to spot mode to get really deep into cracks in the coral or even to point out certain features. I have it mounted to my camera most of the time and it works well for that as well even if it is not technically made for photo.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: BAIT AND SWITCH
customer_reviews.text: Not as pictured. I received the cheaper $211.00 dollar version. If that was the case I would've just paid the $211 and not $279. Now I have to wait for a replacement hope its the correct item, and if not return both. SUCH A HASSLE. Also why is one light 211 and the other 279. I just want what I paid for. Both say Sola dive 1200 s/f the cheaper one says black and the expensive one say blue. Other than that why the price difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright Light
customer_reviews.text: This dive light is extremely bright and has several brightness levels you can use to conserve power while you are diving. I have used the light on several dives and i haven't had a single issue. The hand strap is adjustable and very comfortable to wear with and without gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Spain

customer_reviews.title: Great for Bug hunting!
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic, have taken on 4 dives now and it’s performed amazing! It’s been especially good for Lobstering.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one the other one only lasted for years
customer_reviews.text: First one was $500 lasted 4 years, this one was under $300, second one better price, Had to make straps longer for winter gloves
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Day n' night
customer_reviews.text: Great light. I use if for night dives and photography!
customer_reviews.author: Brian S

customer_reviews.title: Best dive light I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic dive light. I like the different modes and battery life is pretty good. I wish it was a little more affordable but you get fantastic quality for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Cary W

customer_reviews.title: Diving Light
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Leightweight,very small and extremly powerfull.. Probably the best Scubalight on the market. You only habe this Power würg other products, if they have external Tankbatteries and are much larger.
customer_reviews.author: Captain340

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but worth it. Tried it during the day time for photography ,I took a very nice picture with it . If you are looking for one ,go ahead .
customer_reviews.author: B. ZAIDAN

customer_reviews.title: Great dive light an all around use light
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light for diving. I have one for myself to use for photography and my husband commented that he would love to have one of his own just for looking around because it puts the color back into the reef. Got the light for much less on Amazon then what I paid for mine in the dive shop.
customer_reviews.author: A diver

customer_reviews.title: ) This is a great light - fits nicely on my hand
customer_reviews.text: I've been diving with this light every weekend this year (love that Pacific Ocean!) This is a great light - fits nicely on my hand, and shines a powerful beam. It lights up a really wide area on night dives, but doesn't scare off the shrimp or lobster. The narrow beam is awesome for investigating the crevices in the reef; the wide beam is good for night dives. There is a mechanical locking switch, as well as an electronic locking switch (hold the lever forward for 4 seconds). This ensures that the light won't be accidentally activated. I would have given it 5 stars, but I had to squeeze the bank account to afford the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome light, highly recommend for night diving can C clearly like was day with clear visibility of course.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: I used this light on my most recent trip to Key Largos and used it on many Wreck Dives as well as Reef Dives looking into caves. At full charge the charge was enough for a deep dive about 25 min and 50 min reef dive afterwards, I would recharge it for about 1 1/2 hour after my morning dive and use it on my afternoon dives (2 more reef dive), I would use it in med intensity or selective as I need it and was able to get full 4 dives a day on a full charge. It recharges in just few hours so I was ready the next morning. Very comfortable and light weight yet very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Deco Diver

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable illumination
customer_reviews.text: Small, comfortable and lights er up! Have to be cautious with where you point it unless you want to temporarily blind your dive partner.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Thomas

customer_reviews.title: VERY BRIGHT!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for the buck light. Has awesome brightness!! I highly recommend this light to any and all scuba divers :)
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Underwater light
customer_reviews.text: My husband really enjoys his new dive light. It is bright and lighter than his last one. It is a must for all divers
customer_reviews.author: Jean L. Ruckel

customer_reviews.title: Very Practical
customer_reviews.text: I found it very useful when your hands are busy with something els like spearfishing ! I used it once and the battery lasted for approximate 2 hours before the indicator turned red. I was using and switching it between deferent modes. Very reliable and high quality devise.
customer_reviews.author: Husam N. Malaikah

product_meta.title: Light and Motion SOLA Dive 1200 S/F
product_meta.description: "This is one cool dive light. Weighs only 10 ounces, including the battery and hands-free strap, yet it offers a choice of a powerful spot beam or a massive flood beam, each with three power settings." -SCUBALAB Tester's Choice
feature_bullets: Ultra compact lightweight (285 grams); extremely bright 2 mode dive light (1200 lumen flood 500 lumen spot); 3 power settings per mode; perfect for travel
No flooding with factory sealed housing
Rechargeable Li-ion battery with run times up to 270 minutes at low power
60 degrees of clean even flood light illuminates entire field of vision; easily alternate between spot and flood light for maximum versatility
